Name: Aaron Finch
detail: he became the first player to reach 900 rating points on the official International Cricket Council (ICC) T20I rankings

Name: Marcus Harris
detail: He made his Test cricket debut for the Australia national cricket team in December 2018

Name: Usman Khawaja
detail: He has played county cricket in the United Kingdom and briefly played in both the Indian Premier League and Pakistan Super League.

Name: Glenn Maxwell
detail: He also scored an unbeaten 145* from 65 balls against Sri Lanka in 2016, the fourth highest score in Twenty20 Internationals

Name: Matt Renshaw
detail: He scored his maiden first-class century on 6 December 2015 in the 2015–16 Sheffield Shield against New South Wales.

Name: Cameron Green
detail: Averaging 82 runs per innings and taking 20 wickets in eight games in the under 19s national league.

Name: Mitchell Marsh
detail: Marsh has represented Australia in all three forms of cricket, making his debut during the 2011–12 season.

Name: Matthew Wade
detail: In December 2020, Wade captained Australia for the first time in international cricket

Name: Ashton Agar
detail: he played two Test matches for the Australian national side during the 2013 Ashes series.

Name: Mitchell Swepson
detail: he made his international debut for the Australia cricket team in June 2018

Name: Scott Boland
detail: Boland is one of a handful of Indigenous Australians to be selected to play for Australia at international level

Name: Pat Cummins
detail: He is the vice-captain of the team in limited-overs cricket

Name: Josh Hazlewood
detail: He is a tall pace bowler known for his accuracy and has been compared to former Australian paceman Glenn McGrath
